subject: RE: [junit] Re: testXXXX must return void?
msgSnippet: ... It is in src.jar right at the top level directory after you unzip it, unless it has been removed since I last downloaded. ... Outgoing mail is certified
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: areider [mailto:areider@...]

> Also thanks to Mike for the tip about looking at the code, great
> idea. But I dont have any source for junit.jar in the junit3.8.1.zip
> file I downloaded from junit.org (also sourceforge), else I'd have
> fixed this myself. Where do I find the source distro?

It is in src.jar right at the top level directory after you unzip it,
unless it has been removed since I last downloaded.

> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Robert Wenner <robert@p...> wrote:
> > On Monday 23 June 2003 18:43, areider wrote:
> > > I would like to write test methods that I can reuse outside of
> junit,
> > > where I would want to inspect the result of the test. Right now
> I'm
> > > faced with writing the methods twice.
> >
> > The result of the test would be "nothing happens" if it passes or
> an
> > exception if not.
> > Does that suffice?
> > If not, what else do you want to do with the "test result"?
> >
> > Robert
>
